intro: Draba hirta var. altaica, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 centimeters. The plant features small, basal rosettes of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Draba hirta var. altaica is often found in high-altitude meadows and is a characteristic component of alpine flora.
